caption.title: Schematic of the interactive human-climate model.
caption.p: Participants set an economic productivity target, R, which drives economic growth, E, but also generates greenhouse gas emissions, G. Emissions accumulate in the atmosphere, subject to passive removal by natural carbon sinks at rate Îº. CO 2 accumulation, c, generates warming, increasing the global mean temperature, T. Temperature has a negative effect on economic growth. Capacity for economic growth is reduced under increased warming.
